Reviews/Synopsis
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Please go to the following website for detailed information:[/i]
 <a href="
http://www.dvdtalk.com/reviews/21901/faster-blade-poisonous-darts/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.dvdtalk.com/reviews/21901/faster-blade-poisonous-darts/</a>

"Roc Tien stars in this intriguing story of betrayal featuring amazing Wu Tang swordplay and unbelievable dart skills."

This transfer is a mess. The opening scene is fullframe, cropped from its original widescreen aspect ratio to fill the screen. When the opening credits hit (you'll know when they do because of the video generated title screen that hits like a freeze frame) the image is stretched from widescreen to fullscreen so that everyone is tall and very thin. This completely ruins the picture.
 It does go back to the standard 4x3 cropped image once the credits finish, but the fact remains that the compositions in this film are severely compromised and there are moments where characters are talking or doing something important and they're not even visible on the screen.
 The picture quality is pretty atrocious as well, the image is washed out, the colors bleed, and the whole thing is riddled with print damage, dirt, and debris.
 This is a rare film so it's likely that there was nothing else to work with but that doesn't change the fact that the picture quality on this release blows.
